definitions.definition: Organizational structure and governance , especially of a state or a religion .
examples: Church polity was a topic of fierce dispute in 17th-century Britain.

definitions.definition: A politically organized unit, especially a nation of people, a class or ingroup that governs it, or the state ruled thereby.
examples: New polities emerged in Europe after the fall of the Roman Empire.

main_definition: ( politics , religion , usually uncountable ) Organizational structure and governance , especially of a state or a religion .
secondary_definitions: ( political science , countable ) A politically organized unit, especially a nation of people, a class or ingroup that governs it, or the state ruled thereby.
